Posts.Content: bcp_friend wrote: My friend just told me last night that her doctor gave her a birad score of 5 and that she'll be going for a biopsy on monday. She and her husband is a wreck right now. I have never dealt this close breast cancer patients and I am not sure how to be there for them, what to say, what not to say, do I assure her that it's going to be ok or do I tell her to expect the worst and hope for the best. My prayers are always going to be there but I feel like I need to do more than that. Last night all I could tell her was to educate herself on breast cancer, just incase it is not B9, then she knows what steps to take and plan for. And that this is not the end of the road, it's just a start of a new journey. Today is saturday, her biopsy is on monday and she'll probably have the results a day or two after, which means she wont know the result until tuesday. That is a long time of a waiting. Her husband even told me that since the time they knew about this, he would try and keep himself pre-occupied with work just to take his mind off of it. And when he needs to go to the restroom he has to go quickly, so as to avoid thinking about it. It's the weekend now, so both of them are at home with their 7 yr old twin boys. Should me and my wife be there with them just to get their mind off the topic. Last night after she told us and another couple (our closes friends), things kinda calmed down soon as we chit chatted about other stuff. I felt like maybe that is a good way to divert their minds. We both do not have family here in the US, that's why we formed a friendship bond to support each other in celebrations and moment like these.
